channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2456] Dilbert and the lost iPhone
item.description: Our old friend Dilbert and the lost iPhone

item.title: [+1968] Mug Shot of the Year?
item.description: Check out the dude's tat on his lip.

item.title: [+1580] Are Tea Partiers Racist?
item.description: A new study shows that the movement's supporters are more likely to be racially resentful

item.title: [+1380] Anyone else feel this way about movies lately? (Pic)
[+1374] The Secrets of Obama's Underappreciated Success
item.description: The critics on both the left and right will yammer on. But by Election Day, 2010, Obama will have soundly achieved many of his chief campaign promises while running a highly competent, scandal-free government.

item.title: [+1244] The Coke Bottle Cheat Sheet
item.description: If you have a printer/scanner and a bottle of Coke, you can make one of the most epic cheat sheets of all time. This method looks harder than studying...but also a bit more fun.

item.title: [+1191] Expert: Invalid Warrant Used in Raid on iPhone Reporter&#821
item.description: Police raided the house of an editor for Gizmodo on Friday and seized computers and other equipment. The raid was part of an investigation into the leak of

item.title: [+1070] Bring the Pope to Justice
item.description: Detain or subpoena the pope for questioning in the child-rape scandal? You must be joking! All right then, try the only alternative formulation: declare the pope to be above and beyond all local and international laws, and immune when it comes to his personal and institutional responsibility for sheltering criminals. The joke there would be on us.

item.title: [+1008] Girl survives sting by world's deadliest jellyfish
item.description: A 10-year-old schoolgirl has stunned doctors in Australia after she survived being stung by the world's most venomous creature – the box jellyfish. The venom of the box jellyfish is so overpoweringly painful that victims often go in shock and drown or die of heart failure before reaching shore.

item.title: [+908] Girl Giving Grad Speech Tries to Convert Crowd, Collapses
item.description: Video from a Texas public university’s graduation of a girl going absolutely insane and passing out while giving a speech.

item.title: [+839] Sprint Employees Fired for Helping Aging Mall Cop Nab Thief
item.description: Two cell salesmen were heading on break when they heard a cry for help from an aging security guard as a shoplifting suspect blazed past them -- and instead of ignoring this plea, they chased the guy down, caught him, and held him until mall security and police arrived. Their reward for this heroic action? They were fired.

item.title: [+833] "I need a copy of the Internet..." [COMIC]
item.description: Ever had a day like this?

item.title: [+798] Wingnut Texas lawmaker: Obama is 'God's punishment on us.'
item.description: The idiocy just keeps piling up.

item.title: [+722] Why Apple Needs to Loosen Up
item.description: With the iPad, Apple seems to be saying that the first 15 years of the Web have been a huge mistake. In a way, it's good that Apple is doing this because it's an argument we need to have. Yet it's also perplexing.

item.title: [+706] 79% Oppose Putting Ronald Reagan on the $50 Bill
item.description: Rep. Patrick McHenry (R-N.C.) last month proposed putting Ronald Reagan on the $50 bill instead of former president Ulysses S. Grant, arguing that the "last great president" of the 20th century deserved the honor. But 79 percent of Americans oppose the idea, according to a Marist Poll released Thursday. Only 12 percent support McHenry's idea

item.title: [+663] Microsoft Understands How IT Guys Feel
item.description: Microsoft's suddenly has a fantastic sense of humor. First, they sent flowers to the funeral of IE6. Now they're rolling out a new webcomic series called "Where's the 'Any' Key?"

item.title: [+650] A Marine's father fights on for his son
item.description: Albert Snyder is a soft, bear of a man - more teddy than grizzly. But if you mess with his family, he turns fierce. You can see the change whenever the Westboro Baptists of Topeka, Kan., are mentioned. They messed with his son in what he considers an unimaginable way.

item.title: [+620] Share The Road (GIF)
item.description: Ever been behind a bicyclist who thinks they can go 15 mph on main roads and get away with it? I know I have, and not that I have a thing against people on bikes, but maybe you should stick to roads that actually have a bike lane.

item.title: [+583] AMD's $300 6-Core CPU: Too Good to Be True?
item.description: AMD’s new Thuban hexa-core CPUs come out swinging with prices that belie their size

item.title: [+578] Evangelists claim 'Noah's Ark' discovery on Turkish mountain
item.description: A group of Chinese and Turkish evangelical explorers said Monday they believe they may have found Noah's Ark -- four thousand metres up a mountain in Turkey. The team say they recovered wooden specimens from a structure on Mount Ararat in eastern Turkey that carbon dating proved was 4,800 years old, around the same time the ark is said to have been
